summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available primarily relate to his employment and payroll records within the HSCA. One document specifically contains payroll records and related information for Kenneth D. Klein, including salary adjustments and termination details. The documents do not provide specific details about his role in the JFK assassination investigation, but rather focus on the administrative aspects of his employment.
significance: The significance of Kenneth D. Klein lies in his employment with the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the available documents do not detail his specific contributions to the investigation, his payroll records are part of the broader set of administrative documents related to the HSCA's operations.
